metadata.title: CVE-2017-17045 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.9.x allowing HVM guest OS users togain privileges on the host OS, obtain sensitive information, or cause adenial of service (BUG and host OS crash) by leveraging the mishandling ofPopulate on Demand (PoD) Physical-to-Machine (P2M) errors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17045` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxengnttab1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenmisc4.11 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxentoolcore1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxentoollog1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-4.11 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-common - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xenstore-utils - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.2-0ubuntu1').
